result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody John Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:29 AM Cases called: 21CF668, 22CF208, 22CF235, and 22CF292. Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cody John Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Cody John Johnson. Attorney Sarbacker requested on the older 3 cases to have arraignment today. Information filed, reading waived. In regards to the bond issue. In 21CF668 it is a signature bond. In the other cases bond argument by Attorney Sarbacker. State responded, objected to the motion to modify the bond. Court will not forfeit the previously posted cash bonds. The bond in 21CF688 remains. The bond in 208 will be $150.00 cash, which has been posted previously. The bond in 22CF235 is amended back to $500.00 cash bond, previously posted. 10:53 AM

9:58 AM Cases called: 21CF668, 22CF208, and 22CF235. Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody John Johnson in court in custody.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Cody John Johnson. In all cases; Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Attorney Sarbacker requested a new arraignment date. Substitutions were filed on Br. 3 cases. Court signed the substitution request. 10:02 AM

for Bond Modification filed by Defendant
$500.00 previously posted. Defendant must post additional $1500.00 cash bond. All prior conditions remain.

2:35 PM Cases called: 22CF208 and 22CF235. Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cody John Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Cody John Johnson. Also appearing is the poster of bond. Todays hearing is regarding the money being returned. State is opposed to the request, and asked for forfeiture of the cash bond. Court heard statement from the poster of bond. Court denied the request to return the bond to poster and increased the cash bond in 22CF208 to $1000.00 cash, and in 22CF235 to $2000.00 cash. All conditions remain. Attorney Sarbacker objected. New bond remains.
